[1] "It grows up to 14 to 18 inches (35 to 45 cm) and weighs 4.3 lbs. (0.8 to 1.9 kg). The kiwis muscular legs make up around a third of its total body weight, and according to the San Diego Zoo, a ..."
Source: https://www.livescience.com/57813-kiwi-facts.html

[2] "A kiwi after dinner aids digestion Kiwi contains an enzyme called actinidain or actinidin, which is also found in other fruit like pineapple and papaya. Actinidain breaks down protein in foods like meat, dairy and eggs quicker than digestive enzymes, so the next time youre feeling bloated after a protein-heavy meal, eat some kiwi for dessert."
Source: https://guide.michelin.com/us/en/article/dining-in/kiwi-fruit-facts

[3] "Here is the nutrition information for kiwi (per 1 cup fresh kiwi (177 g)). Calories: 108 Carbohydrates: 26 g Fiber: 5 g, 21% Daily Value (DV) Protein: 2 g Fat: 1 g"
Source: https://www.liveeatlearn.com/kiwifruit/
Current date: 1/26/2023
Instructions: Using the provided web search results, write a comprehensive reply to the given prompt. Make sure to cite results using [[number](URL)] notation after the reference. If the provided search results refer to multiple subjects with the same name, write separate answers for each subject.
Prompt: Kiwi:
"At number 6, we have the kiwi. This little fruit packs a big nutritional punch. It's high in vitamin C

and potassium, and it's also a good source of fiber and antioxidants. The kiwi is a small, furry fruit that grows on a vine and is native to China. It typically grows to be around 14 to 18 inches (35 to 45 cm) tall and weighs between 4.3 lbs. (0.8 to 1.9 kg) [[1](https://www.livescience.com/57813-kiwi-facts.html)].

The kiwi also contains an enzyme called actinidain or actinidin, which helps to break down protein in foods like meat, dairy, and eggs faster than other digestive enzymes. This makes it a great fruit to eat after a protein-heavy meal to aid digestion [[2](https://guide.michelin.com/us/en/article/dining-in/kiwi-fruit-facts)].

In terms of nutrition, kiwi is a low-calorie fruit that provides a good amount of vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants. One cup of fresh kiwi contains 108 calories, 26g of carbohydrates, 5g of dietary fiber, 2g of protein, and 1g of fat [[3](https://www.liveeatlearn.com/kiwifruit/)]. It's also high in Vitamin C and Potassium.

Another unique fact about kiwi is its high potassium content. It provides about 10% of the daily recommended intake of potassium.

In terms of availability, Kiwi is available year-round in most supermarkets, but peak kiwi season is from November to May.

Additionally, a script can help you to avoid making mistakes or going off-topic. How do you put a script on YouTube? 1. Create your video content. 2. Upload your video to YouTube. 3. Add the script to the video ..."
Source: https://homebasedpinoy.com/youtube-scriptwriter/

[2] "Video scripts tend to be formatted in a very specific way. A stakeholder like a producer, director, technician, or actor should be able to look at a script at a glance and find what they need. Formatting is so important, says Swertlow. The biggest thing that distinguishes a novice from a professional is the formatting.."
Source: https://www.adobe.com/creativecloud/video/discover/video-script.html

[3] "The easy way to write scripts for your YouTube videos. \*\*\*\*\* Find out How to Come Up with Good Video Ideas for YouTube here ️ https://youtu.be/ZuUOWFfk7kk..."
Source: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8s0i1LutAc4
Current date: 1/26/2023
Instructions: Using the provided web search results, write a comprehensive reply to the given prompt. Make sure to cite results using [[number](URL)] notation after the reference. If the provided search results refer to multiple subjects with the same name, write separate answers for each subject.
Prompt: I want you to act as a YouTube video scriptwriter. I want you to write a 10-minute long script for a YouTube video on the topic "what are the top 10 most nutritious fruits in the world and their health benefits". I want you to keep your tone humorous and informative. Add an interesting hook in the intro and give detailed information about each fruit, its availability, and its market price and unique facts about each fruit.

Hello! I'm excited to be your YouTube scriptwriter for this 10-minute long video on the top 10 most nutritious fruits in the world and their health benefits.

INT. KITCHEN - DAY

A person is seen in the kitchen, looking for something to eat. They open the fridge, but nothing looks appealing. Suddenly, a voice over is heard.

NARRATOR (V.O.)
Are you tired of eating the same old fruits every day? Do you want to know which fruits pack the most nutritional punch? Look no further!

The person closes the fridge and turns to the camera with a look of curiosity.

NARRATOR (V.O.)
In this video, we're counting down the top 10 most nutritious fruits in the world and their health benefits. And don't worry, we'll also be discussing their availability and market prices so you can add them to your grocery list. But first, let's start with a fun fact. Did you know that the avocado is technically a fruit?

The person nods in surprise.

NARRATOR (V.O.)
That's right! Now let's get started with number 10. At number 10 we have the humble blueberry. Not only are they delicious, but they're also packed with antioxidants and vitamins. They're readily available in most grocery stores and can usually be found at a reasonable price.

The person is seen holding a carton of blueberries and smiling.

NARRATOR (V.O.)
Moving on to number 9, we have the pomegranate. These little red gems are packed
